ff851ff8-1a0d-489a-a1f7-6c25d263c24d.description: The Construction Documents badge provides earners with a foundation to better understand different types of construction projects and documents, navigate through a set of drawings and specifications in order to find and use desired information, and assist clients/owners in interpreting the information.
ff851ff8-1a0d-489a-a1f7-6c25d263c24d.name: Construction Documents

badge_template_activities.title: Register for the Construction Documents course. This registration link will take you directly to the badge's Moodle course where you can self-enroll to begin completing the badge. Click on this link, sign into your Moodle account (if necessary), and click "self-enroll". Then you should receive a welcome message detailing your enrollment into the course.
Complete the five asynchronous modules, most including a lecture and a quiz, within 3 weeks of enrollment.

00d21b2a-c68d-43a1-843d-cc299a02cf90.description: In this badge, earners will be introduced to key concepts, terms, and principles that will help guide them through any innovation project. Through a common innovation language, earners will be able to properly communicate and collaborate with their team, leading to a better understanding and ultimately better outcomes.
00d21b2a-c68d-43a1-843d-cc299a02cf90.name: Building an Innovation Language

badge_template_activities.title: Register for the Building an Innovation Language Badge. This registration link will take you directly to the badge's Moodle course where you can self-enroll to begin completing the badge. Click on this link, sign into your Moodle account (if necessary), and click "self-enroll". Then you should receive a welcome message detailing your enrollment into the course.
Watch two Innovation Language videos.
Receive a 100% on both quizzes.

1d0caed2-6487-4f0e-9b11-dc265c411891.description: The Remote Innovation Badge developed with IBM will provide earners with a toolkit of resources and set of skills necessary to create innovative solutions while working in remote teams. Earners of this badge have successfully learned the principles of remote collaboration and digitally-based innovation. They have learned how to build team cohesiveness and utilize design thinking to think creatively and create innovative solutions while working in a remote setting.
1d0caed2-6487-4f0e-9b11-dc265c411891.name: Remote Innovation

badge_template_activities.title: This is a synchronous badge which means it is administered on a cohort-basis. When a new cohort has been announced, registration will open and you will be able to self-enroll here.
Register for and attend two synchronous sessions led by IBM and Clarkson facilitators.
Complete all necessary deliverables, primarily using Mural.
Present final problem statements and research questions with a plan to validate.

dffe0cd8-e2aa-417e-ab68-6163cbeecf96.description: Earners of the Startup Fundamentals badge are able to take a general idea and build it into a potentially viable business concept. Through an understanding of vision, mission, strategies, business plan, and business model canvas, earners can build out a go-to-market strategy from start to finish.
dffe0cd8-e2aa-417e-ab68-6163cbeecf96.name: Start-up Fundamentals

badge_template_activities.title: Register for the Start-up Fundamentals Badge. This registration link will take you directly to the badge's Moodle course where you can self-enroll to begin completing the badge. Click on this link, sign into your Moodle account (if necessary), and click "self-enroll". Then you should receive a welcome message detailing your enrollment into the course.
Complete the Start-up Fundamentals course, including four 1-hour modules.
Receive a 100% on all four quizzes.

5eb5bbc4-f723-4d14-86fc-98cd2fa6c03b.description: Construction Trades & Labor Relations introduces participants to the world of construction and the partnership between management and labor. It covers key concepts in defining and understanding trades, labor organizations, and roles for a successful construction project. It also provides a basis for effective communications and coordination within the entire project team.
5eb5bbc4-f723-4d14-86fc-98cd2fa6c03b.name: Construction Trades and Labor Relations

badge_template_activities.title: Register for the Construction Trades and Labor Relations Micro-Credential. This registration link will take you directly to the Micro-Credential's Moodle course where you can self-enroll to begin completing the Micro-Credential. Click on this link, sign into your Moodle account (if necessary), and click "self-enroll". Then you should receive a welcome message detailing your enrollment into the course.
Receive a passing score for each quiz at the end of each module. Watch all lectures before attempting the quizzes.

d2363720-88c1-441e-9440-36819243a04e.description: The Python Environment and Syntax badge is comprised of one microcourse which will provide earners with a knowledge of the Python environment, about the language syntax, concepts, vocabulary and ways to use Python. Students completing this badge will be able to identify cases where Python can be used to solve a problem, set up a Python environment and write and run basic Python scripts.
d2363720-88c1-441e-9440-36819243a04e.name: Python Environment and Syntax

badge_template_activities.title: Register for the Python Environment and Syntax Badge. This registration link will take you directly to the badge's Moodle course where you can self-enroll to begin completing the badge. Click on this link, sign into your Moodle account (if necessary), and click "self-enroll". Then you should receive a welcome message detailing your enrollment into the course.

Complete the Introduction to Python Environment and Syntax course. This course include six modules discussing how to install Jupyter lab, how to use Python syntax, basic Python data types, logical expressions, and how to run basic Python scripts.
Receive an 80% on every quiz after each module and submit each problem set.

98f5fa08-27a7-411e-9662-7cf33103fe5f.description: The Construction Site Planning and Logistics badge, developed with Turner Construction, teaches earners about site and logistics planning for a variety of construction project types. Earners will gain an understanding of the factors that go into successful site planning and participate in two case studies regarding restricted and non-restricted sites. Once completed, earners will have an applied understanding of the considerations necessary for planning a successful construction project.
98f5fa08-27a7-411e-9662-7cf33103fe5f.name: Construction Site Planning and Logistics

badge_template_activities.title: This badge will be offered in Fall 2022 to Clarkson students and Turner employees. Please email badges@clarkson.edu if interested in participating in this badge.
Complete the Construction Site Planning and Logistics course which consists of one introductory synchronous session, 6 asynchronous modules, and one synchronous group case-study.
Complete all synchronous and asynchronous work, including module quizzes and the group case-study.

323613e6-6447-4aad-ada4-67e4b0e21747.description: Fundamentals of Negotiation is a seminar introducing the field of negotiation. This corporate micro-credetial covers key concepts and puts those concepts into action through a negotiation simulation case consisting of teams of participants playing the role of parties to a negotiation. Earners will develop a more nuanced understanding of negotiations and experience self-evaluation and reflection, enabling earners to become an effective negotiator as their respective careers progress.
323613e6-6447-4aad-ada4-67e4b0e21747.name: Fundamentals of Negotiations

badge_template_activities.title: This is a synchronous micro-credential which means it is administered on a cohort-basis. When a new cohort has been announced, registration will open and you will be able to register here.
Attend and participate in the Negotiations seminar, including completing pre-work and participating in the negotiations simulation.

a552d4ba-ffac-4484-9524-6283cc8c2bdc.description: The Introduction to Technical Sales badge introduces earners to the world of Technical Sales. This badge consists of four courses, including: An Introduction to Technical Sales, Discovering the Sales Process, Managing Sales Relationships, and Making Dollars and Cents of It All. Once completing this badge, earners will have an applied understanding of the occupation in terms of the necessary skills, the role within a company, and value of a Technical Salesperson.
a552d4ba-ffac-4484-9524-6283cc8c2bdc.name: Introduction to Technical Sales

badge_template_activities.title: Register for the Intro to Technical Sales course. This registration link will take you directly to the badge's Moodle course where you can self-enroll to begin completing the badge. Click on this link, sign into your Moodle account (if necessary), and click "Enroll me". Then you should receive a welcome message detailing your enrollment into the course.
Complete the Intro to Technical Sales course, including three modules. This course introduces earners to the field of Technical Sales with common language and basic processes.
Complete the Discovering the Sales Process course, including three modules. This course showcases the sales process, customer need types, and question types to earners.
Complete the Managing Sales Relationships course, including 2 modules. This course details processes and techniques for managing sales relationships.

Complete the Making Dollars and Cents of It All course, including 4 modules. This course introduces concepts such as estimating the customer's investment, payback, the ethics of sales, and techniques for closing the deal.
Complete the Central Assignment at a satisfactory level.

90687f93-f200-4dbb-9949-4080400d44e2.description: The Innovation Development Badge will provide learners with a replicable framework for completing innovation-based projects from start to finish with the help of mentors and experts. Through a series of guided 30-minute 1-on-1 sessions, earners will build skills in various innovation practices including patent searches, user insight, prototyping, and communicating innovation.
90687f93-f200-4dbb-9949-4080400d44e2.name: Innovation Development

badge_template_activities.title: Building an Innovation Language

Register for the Innovation Development course. This registration link will take you directly to the badge's Moodle course where you can self-enroll to begin completing the badge. Click on this link, sign into your Moodle account (if necessary), and click "self-enroll". Then you should receive a welcome message detailing your enrollment into the course.
Attend seven 30 minute 1-on-1 sessions, available from February 2nd to March 23rd.
Submit all deliverables for all 1-on-1 sessions.
Pass/Fail. Earners will be graded on their participation within the sessions and the quality of deliverable submissions.

f83d1d01-7bc2-42a0-855b-66724d0bf024.description: The Valuing Startups micro-credential showcases the primary valuation tools used by investors to value a startup firm. Tools include learning how to read financial statements, make pro-forma statements, estimate future earnings and cashflows; all in an effort to estimate a firm's value. This micro-credential includes a 1-hour in-person case-study led by an industry expert.
f83d1d01-7bc2-42a0-855b-66724d0bf024.name: Valuing Startups

badge_template_activities.title: Proficiency in Excel is required in order to successfully complete this micro-credential.
This is a synchronous micro-credential which means it is administered on a cohort-basis. When a new cohort has been announced, registration will open and you will be able to register here.
Complete the Valuing Startups course which consists of 3 asynchronous modules. This course will take approximately 3 hours to complete. The course must be completed prior to the in-person case-study.
Attend the 1-hour in-person case-study led by the industry expert.

a06dbf01-948e-48ff-9dd3-3601332152bf.description: The Supply Chain Optimization Using a Systems Approach Executive Seminar is a live/online program designed to provide an overview of current trends and proven strategies to optimize the supply chain by utilizing a systems approach. There are four target topics, as well as opportunities for networking and collaboration in an online environment. Topics include Emerging Trends, Measuring Supply Chain Financial Performance, Negotiations and Relationship Management, and Coping with Disruptions.
a06dbf01-948e-48ff-9dd3-3601332152bf.name: Supply Chain Optimization: Using a Systems Approach

badge_template_activities.title: Participants attend two live, 4 hour and 30 minute sessions.

Participants will turn in a written assessment reviewing the concepts covered and describing how they can apply the concepts/ideas covered in their workplace with concrete examples. Program Director will review for completeness of topics and provide feedback accordingly. Additional personal/professional development/integration plan will be discussed with participants based on topics covered.

2263de38-1048-4c2b-93fd-6bc1a91d31e5.description: In this badge, earners will be introduced to 3D spatial thinking skills through tutorials and exercises. Topics include: getting familiar with isometric drawings, orthographic drawings, orthographic projections, and inclined and curved surfaces.
2263de38-1048-4c2b-93fd-6bc1a91d31e5.name: Introduction to Isometric Sketching and Design

badge_template_activities.title: Register for the Introduction to Isometric Sketching and Design Badge. This registration link will take you directly to the badge's Moodle course where you can self-enroll to begin completing the badge. Click on this link, sign into your Moodle account (if necessary), and click "self-enroll". Then you should receive a welcome message detailing your enrollment into the course.
Complete the Introduction to Isometric Sketching and Design course, including 5 modules.
Receive at least an 80% on the final assessment, a design project.

d2039c20-bd2c-4013-8f06-0e9ac7adaab6.description: This microcredential covers risk management processes for identifying, assessing, responding to, and controlling individual project risks, then applying that knowledge to assess overall project risks (cost and schedule). If well done, we ensure that all our projects are as successful as possible. Tools & techniques are examined, as is the know-how for effectively balancing and re-balancing project plans per risk tolerance guidelines, based on organizational governance to control all projects.
d2039c20-bd2c-4013-8f06-0e9ac7adaab6.name: Managing Project Risks

badge_template_activities.title: Work through the following four asynchronous lessons: Individual Project Risks, Overall Project Risks, Risk Response Strategies, Monitoring & Controlling Risks and Projects.
Pass multiple, short "knowledge check" quizzes (multiple retries are allowed).
Pass a final exam, which is largely a compilation of 26 quiz questions taken from the four lessons, with a score of 80% or higher.
This micro-credential will be available beginning June 1, 2022.

ded1e09e-bcde-44d4-867f-71b13dc1c63e.description: The Digital Transformation badge developed with Siemens introduces earners to emerging digital technology trends including 5G, AI, and the future of computing. Earners of this badge are able to address the impacts that these technologies are having on the product lifecycle of diverse industries. They will be able to illustrate techniques and applications of digital solutions across the product lifecycle.
ded1e09e-bcde-44d4-867f-71b13dc1c63e.name: Digital Transformation

badge_template_activities.title: Register for the Digital Transformation micro-credential. This registration link will take you directly to the badge's Moodle course where you can self-enroll to begin completing the badge. Click on this link, sign into your Moodle account (if necessary), and click "self-enroll". Then you should receive a welcome message detailing your enrollment into the course.
Complete the 3 modules going over an overview of digital transformation, technology trends, and the product lifecycle.
Earn a passing score on each end-of module quiz.

796867f9-ddb0-43fb-95c8-0b16a964db17.description: In this micro-credential, you will learn about three advanced Project Management Tools & Techniques: IMS (Integrated Master Schedule), SRA (Schedule Risk Analysis), and Earned Value/Schedule Management.
796867f9-ddb0-43fb-95c8-0b16a964db17.name: Advanced Project Management Tools & Techniques

badge_template_activities.title: Work through the following three asynchronous and interactive lessons: The IMS (Integrated Master Schedule), SRA (Schedule Risk Analysis), and EV (Earned Value) and ES (Earned Schedule) Management.
Pass multiple, short "knowledge check" quizzes (multiple retries are allowed).
Pass a final exam, which is largely a compilation of 26 quiz questions taken from the four lessons, with a score of 80% or higher.
This micro-credential will be available beginning June 1, 2022.

e255d92e-0d40-4a3f-91cd-52eb1826c57c.description: The Fundamentals of User Experience badge introduces earners to the global social media landscape through a hybrid course model. Concepts introduced in this badge include: user research, story mapping, wireframing, and interaction flows, and design of interfaces and applications. Earners of this badge have researched, brainstormed, mapped, and refined a wireflow using Adobe XD.
e255d92e-0d40-4a3f-91cd-52eb1826c57c.name: Fundamentals of User Experience

badge_template_activities.title: This hybrid badge was a part of the AT&T & Clarkson Digital Experience which occurred in late 2021. Please email badges@clarkson.edu if interested in participating in this badge.

Complete the Fundamentals of User Experience course, which consists of four modules detailing: (1) research and personas, (2)user stories and the story map, (3) slicing epics and the wireflow, and (4) prototype, test and redesign.
Earn a passing score on each end-of-module submission, including the final project: a clickable interactive prototype.

941ae651-ef02-478c-ad94-2b1c80f295df.description: This micro-credential focuses on three important leadership topics. First is Maintaining a Balanced Plan, one of the most potentially frustrating activities in project, program, portfolio, and functional management. Second is the different Product Development Processes used to execute the project plan (i.e., Predictive/Waterfall, Iterative/Incremental, Agile/Adaptive, and Hybrid [a combo]). The third is on project management leadership (responsibilities, competencies, and selection).
941ae651-ef02-478c-ad94-2b1c80f295df.name: General Project Management Topics for Leaders

badge_template_activities.title: Work through the following three asynchronous lessons: Maintaining a Balanced Plan, The PDP (Product Development Process), and Project Team Leadership.
Pass multiple, short "knowledge check" quizzes (multiple retries are allowed).
Pass a final exam, which is largely a compilation of 26 quiz questions taken from the four lessons, with a score of 80% or higher.
This micro-credential will be available beginning June 1, 2022.

63a19577-e230-47d8-b60a-86e32a44ca7b.description: This course is a series of construction-related topics that will help careers in the building construction field. They will be taught by senior Turner staff with many years of experience in their respective fields.
63a19577-e230-47d8-b60a-86e32a44ca7b.name: Introduction to Major Building Systems

badge_template_activities.title: Students enrolled in this course will be required to take several learning assessments upon each completion of a section. Users who receive a passing grade for all assessments will earn this badge.

skills.name: Construction And Analysis Of Distributed Processes

09cf28c6-1a73-4803-8e0e-ce6fd60465e2.description: This micro-credential examines (via case study examples) how portfolio management aligns organizational strategic goals and objectives to project charter requirements. Ways to proactively manage project and program stakeholder expectations are explained, as well as how projects are effectively initiated and planned. Learn some key tools and techniques that facilitate the planning process to establish “balanced” project plans from which to benchmark, track and govern project team performance.
09cf28c6-1a73-4803-8e0e-ce6fd60465e2.name: Project Portfolio Management

badge_template_activities.title: Work through the following four asynchronous lessons: Requirements Management, Portfolio Case Study, Managing Expectations, Project Planning.
Pass multiple, short "knowledge check" quizzes (multiple retries are allowed).
Pass a final exam, which is largely a compilation of 26 quiz questions taken from the four lessons, with a score of 80% or higher.
This micro-credential will be available beginning June 1, 2022.

873255f8-207f-4f38-98c7-31598272804d.description: The Strategic Project Management credential represents a working awareness of the key success factors for organizational, portfolio, program, and project management as they relate to product development within any industry or enterprise. You will learn how to determine the most appropriate “best practices” to implement, as well as the key practical concepts that underpin successful management of projects throughout the enterprise via the appropriate level of governance and leadership skills.
873255f8-207f-4f38-98c7-31598272804d.name: Strategic Project Management

badge_template_activities.title: The Strategic Project Management micro-credential is the final, culminating credential of a learning pathway made up of other micro-credentials. It represents that earners have successfully completed the five micro-credentials listed below and have thus demonstrated a solid conceptual understanding of Strategic Project Management.
Project Portfolio Management
Strategic Project Management Methodologies
Managing Project Risks
General Project Management Topics for Leaders
Advanced Project Management Tools & Techniques
This micro-credential will be available beginning June 1, 2022.

5c1f7d6a-74e6-4dc8-b30f-f023bc5c159b.description: This micro-credential will acquaint you with PMI’s PMBOK (PM Body of Knowledge) Guide. We learn how causes of unsuccessful project execution (due to both “technical” and “management” issues) have led to advancements in PM T&Ts (Tools & Techniques) over time, as well as their usage. We explore how T&T “best practices” are determined through postmortem analyses and why good organizations institutionalize postmortems. We will also look at postmortem processes and some case study examples.
5c1f7d6a-74e6-4dc8-b30f-f023bc5c159b.name: Strategic Project Management Methodologies

badge_template_activities.title: Work through the following four asynchronous lessons: General PM Tools & Techniques, PM Tools & Techniques Options, PM Bests Practices, Project Postmortems.
Pass multiple, short "knowledge check" quizzes (multiple retries are allowed).
Pass a final exam, which is largely a compilation of 26 quiz questions taken from the four lessons, with a score of 80% or higher.
This micro-credential will be available beginning June 1, 2022.
